info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 1 at 4:17PM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
info.description:
An unsettled weather pattern remains in store for Palau and Yap through at least the weekend, as two tropical disturbances known as Invests 99W and 90W remain to be the primary weather makers in western Micronesia.
JTWC's Invest 99W is currently centered near 8N131E west-northwest of Palau's coastal waters, continuing its trek away from the region as monsoon-like flow continues to bring heavy showers, thunderstorms and gusty winds to the region for the next several days. Due to the continuous delays in potential tropical cyclone development, shower coverage is expected to continue to diminish along the southeastern peripheries, which brings diminished shower coverage to much of Palau. However, showers and thunderstorms are expected to remain heavy whenever they do occur, but variability in areas of convective development may produce periods of little to no weather as well once a "dirty ridge" develops nearby. At this time, landslides continue to be unlikely; however, if soils become saturated, any additional rainfall may quickly become runoff and increase mudslide risks. On- and-off showers are expected for a little longer after 99W's exit, with drier conditions expected by the middle of next week.
JTWC's Invest 90W is currently centered near 4N141E well south of Eauripik in eastern Yap State, slowly drifting northward as a muddled mess of convection with a lackluster center of rotation. Model guidance was pinging on this feature to become the more dominant one in the region for many model runs, but the environment has continued to be unforgiving, disallowing 90W from consolidating significantly. Even so, model guidance continues to show this feature to continue to shift north-northwestward across much of eastern Yap State, potentially becoming an open wave as is passes over Yap Proper during the weekend. During passage, this system will bring numerous heavy showers, some thunderstorms and gusty winds Saturday and Saturday night, with conditions improving considerably by early next week.
Residents and mariners should monitor the latest forecasts for the region at weather.gov/gum/PublicForecasts and any information shared by WSO Palau and WSO Yap for their local regions.

parameter.value: HEAVY SHOWERS AND GUSTY WINDS REMAIN POSSIBLE THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK

area.areaDesc: Yap; Melekeok; Airai; Koror; Peleliu; Angaur
